p: One critical distinction between the study designs important for their interpretation was that comprehensive baseline HIV testing was done only in the intervention arms in BCPP and HPTN 071 and in both intervention and control arms in SEARCH and TasP. In the two latter trials, expanded ART eligibility in the control communitiesÂ thus occurred in the context of extremely high knowledge of HIV status. Thus, differences between intervention and control arms were reduced, and were due primarily to differences in linkage, ART start and care delivery.
